title: Lesson 60
paragraph: This lesson explores fate and destiny, including providence, prophecy, and inevitability.

words.meaning: the protective care of God or fate
words.example: They believed it was providence that saved them.

words.meaning: the occurrence of happy or beneficial events by chance
words.japaneseMeaning: 偶然の幸運、セレンディピティ
words.example: Finding the book in the old library was pure serendipity.

words.japaneseMeaning: あらかじめ定められた、運命づけられた
words.example: He felt his career was preordained.

words.meaning: having far-reaching and often disastrous consequences
words.example: The fateful decision changed the course of history.

words.meaning: an event regarded as a portent of good or evil
words.example: The black cat was considered an ill omen.

words.meaning: a prediction of what will happen in the future
words.example: The oracle gave a prophecy of great change.

words.meaning: the quality of being certain to happen
words.example: The inevitability of change cannot be denied.

words.meaning: the occurrence of events without apparent cause
words.example: By chance, they met at the café.

words.meaning: a remarkable concurrence of events without apparent connection
words.example: It was a coincidence that they wore the same outfit.
